player

Class KaraokeController

  • java.lang.Object
    • player.KaraokeController

  • public class KaraokeController
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple implementation of a karaoke. Uses MIDI format to play music, and uses the terminal as the user interface. Joins information of abc files and MIDI. Have control over the basic flow of a karaoke player. Immutable.
    Author:
    Nicholas M. Mizoguchi

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      KaraokeController(java.lang.String folder)
      Constructor

    • Constructor Detail

      • KaraokeController

        public KaraokeController(java.lang.String folder)
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        folder - the path to the folder where the .abc files are located.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Starts the karaoke controller. Gives the option to the user to select musics to play. Accepts only positive integers that are mapping an .abc file, and it stops running if the users type an empty string (pressing enter).

      • play

        public static void play(java.lang.String file)
        Plays the input file using Java MIDI API and displays header information to the standard output stream. It opens file, represent it in a playable format, and then starts playing. This method use a default listener to treat lyrics (print it to the terminal).
        Parameters:
        file - The name of input abc file
